intro: Digitalis lingulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved foxglove, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the genus Digitalis, which includes several species known for their bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring tall, erect stems with lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually purple or violet, with a distinctive spurred shape at the back. Digitalis lingulata is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and rocky areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
